talk.author: did:plc:66v2guukgmr3uny2zqqolcf7
talk.utter: One day people won't want a digital file unless it's an NFT. It means non-fungible token. You can literally attach ANYTHING to it. talk.author: did:plc:222p42fegwhwfyrc3gqam76j
talk.utter:
Except that, fundamentally, ISN'T how NFT's work. You don't own a tangible THING, you "own" at best a single copy of a digital item. It's infinitely replicable in a forensically identical fashion.
I'm no big fan of how crazy the art market gets but at least there's only ONE "original"

talk.author: did:plc:222p42fegwhwfyrc3gqam76j
talk.utter: that can NEVER be identically replicated. Digital items aren't the same. They're infinitely, identically replicable.

talk.author: did:plc:66v2guukgmr3uny2zqqolcf7
talk.utter: You see the Mona Lisa all the time and don't buy the painting. NFTs are referencing public files. The media industry would rather you pay a subscription or flat rate for everything you do. NFTs allow investors to buy it while everyone else enjoys it for free. Just like stocks, it can generate money.

talk.author: did:plc:66v2guukgmr3uny2zqqolcf7
talk.utter: I think the same thing about stocks tbh. The prices of stocks are controlled by AI systems and wealthy elite who have massive whale positions. Blockchain and NFTs allows us to apply immutable code to a system of digital assets and content, revolutionizing how we deal with internet and assets.

talk.author: did:plc:66v2guukgmr3uny2zqqolcf7
talk.utter: Intellectual property has value. You can use NFTs to create licenses and IDs and copyrights and deeds. Anything we keep digital needs systemic backing and enforcement to retain value. We can automate all of that with Blockchain now. The new world is coming. Brace!
